rubrics.name: Clear Requirements
rubrics.description: How clearly and completely the user specifies their requirements and goals
rubrics.scoring_criteria:
1: Vague or missing requirements, AI must guess intent
2: Basic requirements stated but missing important details
3: Adequate requirements with some ambiguity
4: Clear requirements with good context and specifics
5: Excellent requirements with comprehensive context, constraints, and expected outcomes

rubrics.name: Effective Context Provision
rubrics.description: How well the user provides relevant context about their codebase, environment, and constraints
rubrics.scoring_criteria:
1: No context provided, AI works blindly
2: Minimal context, missing critical information
3: Some context but incomplete or disorganized
4: Good context with relevant details about codebase and environment
5: Comprehensive context including architecture, constraints, and related code

rubrics.name: Iterative Refinement
rubrics.description: How effectively the user refines and clarifies requests based on AI responses
rubrics.scoring_criteria:
1: No refinement, accepts first response regardless of quality
2: Minimal feedback, unclear corrections
3: Some refinement but could be more specific
4: Good iterative feedback that guides AI toward better solutions
5: Excellent refinement with specific corrections and clear direction

rubrics.name: Problem Decomposition
rubrics.description: How well the user breaks down complex problems into manageable pieces
rubrics.scoring_criteria:
1: Presents overwhelming complex requests without structure
2: Some attempt at breaking down but still too broad
3: Reasonable decomposition with room for improvement
4: Good problem breakdown into logical steps
5: Excellent decomposition with clear milestones and dependencies

rubrics.name: Quality Verification
rubrics.description: How well the user verifies and tests AI-generated solutions
rubrics.scoring_criteria:
1: No verification, blindly accepts all outputs
2: Minimal checking, misses obvious issues
3: Some verification but not systematic
4: Good verification with testing and review
5: Thorough verification including edge cases and integration testing
